reviewText:
This game is both frustrating and boring at the same time.

The physics of the game don't behave properly at times, collision detection is spotty on what it counts as touching something. I can't tell you how many times I'd gotten mad when those little creatures fell though something they should have bounced off of...

Some of the puzzles can be solved in ONE move... and those are later in the game where things should be more difficult.

The practically non-existent controls are just horrible. Again I can't tell you how many times I've tried to drag and drop something only to move the camera at a moment where seconds are critical. And at one point I couldn't complete a level even though I figured out where every single object needs to go because I can't move my hand fast and accurate enough to save all 69 of the little buggers.

If the controls were at least improved for some keyboard shortcuts then I'd say it would be a 'meh' game. Something to kill time.

But as it is right now with the flaky physics the horrible controls I can say that it isn't worth your time...

Good thing I got it on sale for practically nothing or else I'd have complained.
voteText: 17 of 17 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Zonitron Production's entire business models of getting people to buy thei junk games that aren't even at a free flash level for $0.14 because they have cards worth $0.20 has been upended by Steam's new minimum $0,49 selling price.  At  least there's always Indie Gala to bundle their entire terrible catalog for $1!

reviewText:
A Basic Physics Puzzle Gamehttps://youtu.be/on8tkpVssHQ
Essentially you are trying to lead a group of guys to the goal by placing jump pads and blocks around the level.

+ Relaxing, not too difficult or demanding

- UI is pretty poorly designed, you have to click and drag on the jump pads to the stage, but if you click slightly off of it your entire screen will move.
- Men spawn too quickly which makes it hard to place everything you need on the stage in time.
- The goal sound isn't very appealing
- I think the game is too simple to really be worth a purchase.

Overall it's a decent physics based puzzle game, but it's just too basic to really recommend.

reviewText:
Get all the little minions from the Start Point to the Finish Point with springs and shapes that you drag onto the level.

Seems simple enough...

HOWEVER, the first few levels may seem too easy. It progressively gets harder and throws some twists into it; for example, if they fall too far, the little minions die so under certain circumstances you will be required to place your shapes well-before they arrive, or they die.

You have to be really precise when clicking on the shapes to drag them on the map, which is really frustrating on some of the levels, but still fun in the long run.

reviewText:
They Came From The Moon, another Zonitron Productions game. Another game that should be on phone or a tablet. This game is a lot like the classic ol' Lemmings (you guys remember that game?)

Pros:
-Has a level editor
-Not very demanding as a game

Cons:
-Music is annoying as ever
-Becomes too repetitive, too quickly
-Physics is not accurate with regards to the puzzles
-The characters spawn too quickly and don't give you time to set up properly

Overall, this isn't a too bad game, but I would not buy it unless it was on sale.
5/10
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Just too hard on my eyes to have fun with it.  Most of the visual display is fine.  But the icons to drag and the number available is so small, even on my 47 TV at full screen.  The game doesn't seem to have any resolution choices.  The main play space is very large.  Not sure why they made the stuff you need to use so small.  The UI could be easier to use.  Otherwise the puzzles were bland but ok.  (1/5 stars

This is a simple Lemmings-like game. You have some aliens and you have to control them to the wormhole/vortex, the end of every stage.

The game is simple like that, and maybe too simples. It lacks a bit of soul. You'll use your things to help them surpass the levels and that's it. Again, like most of the games of this developer, they failed to add the fun part to the game, because it gets boring almost immediately.

The game is not worth, so you shouldn't get it. Forget about it.

reviewText:
This was part of a 10 pack of games for $1.09 CDN.

So the question is:

In spite of the bad collision detection, dodgy physics, poor mouse control, and level designs that not only extend past the edges of my monitor, but also manage to be zoomed in on an area that is neither the beginning or the end of the level, was I able to get 11 cents of enjoyment out of this?

Nope.
